intro: Dasynema cuneifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dasynema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky outcrops. The plant produces small, wind-dispersed seeds, which contribute to its propagation in arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
